in total, there are 2*M outlets (default value: 10)\n    t_max : (optional) upper limit on the simulation time (default value: 0)\n    window_size : (optional) length of the sliding window (default value: 0)\n    tol : tolerance on the sliding-window variances (default value: 0.02)\n    sfreq : (optional) state saving frequency (default value: 0)\n    ---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n    Returns\n    ---------------------------------------------------------------------------\n    if sfreq > 0:\n        list_rhoF : detailed time evolution (with a sampling frequency of sfreq) of the number of F news consumers\n        X_Ymedia : detailed time evolution (with a sampling frequency of sfreq) of the number of Y media outlets subscribed to by X news consumers (X and Y standing for T or F)\n        Xmedia_Y : detailed time evolution (with a sampling frequency of sfreq) of the number of Y news consumers subscribed to X media outlets (X and Y standing for T or F)\n    elif sfreq == 0:\n        time_range : time-step evolution\n        list_polarised : detailed time evolution of the number of polarised individuals\n        list_rhoF : detailed time evolution of the number of F news consumers\n        list_FT_edges : detailed time evolution of the number of FT (unbalanced/active) edges\n    else:\n        v_polarised : final number of polarised individuals\n        rhoF : final number of F n""ews consumers in the population\n        nFT_edges : final number of FT (unbalanced/active) edges\n    ";

 127:              int t_max=0, Py_ssize_t window_size=0, double tol=0.02, int sfreq=0):
 128:     """
 129:     Simulates the flow of the news across a co-evolving graph with a media layer and a population layer.
 130:     ===========================================================================
 131:     Parameters
 132:     ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 133:     g : an unweighted undirected graph
 134:     F0 : initial number of F news consumers
 135:     eta : rate of rewiring to the media
 136:     lambda_F : spreading rate of F news
 137:     lambda_T : spreading rate of T news (default value: 1)
 138:     M : number of T (= F) media outlets; in total, there are 2*M outlets (default value: 10)
 139:     t_max : (optional) upper limit on the simulation time (default value: 0)
 140:     window_size : (optional) length of the sliding window (default value: 0)
 141:     tol : tolerance on the sliding-window variances (default value: 0.02)
 142:     sfreq : (optional) state saving frequency (default value: 0)
 143:     ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 144:     Returns
 145:     ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 146:     if sfreq > 0:
 147:         list_rhoF : detailed time evolution (with a sampling frequency of sfreq) of the number of F news consumers
 148:         X_Ymedia : detailed time evolution (with a sampling frequency of sfreq) of the number of Y media outlets subscribed to by X news consumers (X and Y standing for T or F)
 149:         Xmedia_Y : detailed time evolution (with a sampling frequency of sfreq) of the number of Y news consumers subscribed to X media outlets (X and Y standing for T or F)
 150:     elif sfreq == 0:
 151:         time_range : time-step evolution
 152:         list_polarised : detailed time evolution of the number of polarised individuals
 153:         list_rhoF : detailed time evolution of the number of F news consumers
 154:         list_FT_edges : detailed time evolution of the number of FT (unbalanced/active) edges
 155:     else:
 156:         v_polarised : final number of polarised individuals
 157:         rhoF : final number of F news consumers in the population
 158:         nFT_edges : final number of FT (unbalanced/active) edges
 159:     """
 160:
